risk3r 0.3.0.9000

    Example using risk3r

    risk3r.Rmd

    You can also embed plots, for example:

    Packages and data

    data("germancredit", package = "scorecard")

credit <- germancredit
credit <- rename(credit, bad = creditability)
credit <- mutate(credit, bad = as.numeric(bad == "bad"))
glimpse(credit)
    ## Rows: 1,000
## Columns: 21
## $ status.of.existing.checking.account                      <fct> ... < 0 DM, 0~
## $ duration.in.month                                        <dbl> 6, 48, 12, 42~
## $ credit.history                                           <fct> critical acco~
## $ purpose                                                  <chr> "radio/televi~
## $ credit.amount                                            <dbl> 1169, 5951, 2~
## $ savings.account.and.bonds                                <fct> unknown/ no s~
## $ present.employment.since                                 <fct> ... >= 7 year~
## $ installment.rate.in.percentage.of.disposable.income      <dbl> 4, 2, 2, 2, 3~
## $ personal.status.and.sex                                  <fct> male : divorc~
## $ other.debtors.or.guarantors                              <fct> none, none, n~
## $ present.residence.since                                  <dbl> 4, 2, 3, 4, 4~
## $ property                                                 <fct> "real estate"~
## $ age.in.years                                             <dbl> 67, 22, 49, 4~
## $ other.installment.plans                                  <fct> none, none, n~
## $ housing                                                  <fct> own, own, own~
## $ number.of.existing.credits.at.this.bank                  <dbl> 2, 1, 1, 1, 2~
## $ job                                                      <fct> skilled emplo~
## $ number.of.people.being.liable.to.provide.maintenance.for <dbl> 1, 1, 2, 2, 2~
## $ telephone                                                <fct> "yes, registe~
## $ foreign.worker                                           <fct> yes, yes, yes~
## $ bad                                                      <dbl> 0, 1, 0, 0, 1~
    set.seed(123)

credit <- credit %>% 
  mutate(
    sample = sample(
      c("train", "test"), 
      prob = c(0.5, .5), 
      size = nrow(credit),
      replace = TRUE
      )
  )

credit %>% count(sample, bad)
    ##   sample bad   n
## 1   test   0 371
## 2   test   1 136
## 3  train   0 329
## 4  train   1 164

    Getting woes

    dtrain <- credit %>% 
  filter(sample == "train") %>% 
  select(-sample)

bins <- scorecard::woebin(dtrain, y = "bad")
    ## [INFO] creating woe binning ...
    dbiv <- woebin_summary(bins)

knitr::kable(dbiv)
    variable n_categories iv ks hhi count_distr_max count_distr_min has_missing has_special_values monotone factor iv_lbl hhi_lbl distribution

    # bins2 <- woebin2(dtrain, y = "bad", method = "ctree")

    Remove variables woebin exclude:

    vars <- dbiv %>% 
  pull(variable)

dtrain <- dtrain %>% 
  select(bad, all_of(vars))

    Apply woes to train table.

    dtrain <- as_tibble(woebin_ply(dtrain, bins))
    ## [INFO] converting into woe values ...
    dtest <-  credit %>% 
  filter(sample == "test") %>% 
  woebin_ply(bins) %>% 
  as_tibble()
    ## [INFO] converting into woe values ...
    glimpse(dtrain)
    ## Rows: 493
## Columns: 21

    Modelling

    We’ll remove unpredictive variables.

    vars <- dbiv %>% 
  filter(iv > 0.02) %>% 
  pull(variable) %>% 
  str_c("_woe")

dtrain <- dtrain %>% 
  select(bad, all_of(vars))

model <- glm(bad ~ ., data = dtrain, family = binomial(link = logit))

broom::tidy(model)
    ## # A tibble: 16 x 5
##    term                                  estimate std.error statistic    p.value
##    <chr>                                    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
##  1 (Intercept)                             -0.732     0.124    -5.92     3.25e-9
##  2 status.of.existing.checking.account_~    0.778     0.167     4.66     3.22e-6
##  3 purpose_woe                              0.909     0.228     3.99     6.51e-5
##  4 credit.history_woe                       0.694     0.239     2.90     3.71e-3
##  5 duration.in.month_woe                    1.05      0.251     4.18     2.98e-5
##  6 credit.amount_woe                        1.19      0.255     4.69     2.76e-6
##  7 savings.account.and.bonds_woe            0.748     0.283     2.64     8.31e-3
##  8 present.employment.since_woe             1.02      0.340     3.01     2.64e-3
##  9 age.in.years_woe                         0.716     0.342     2.09     3.64e-2
## 10 other.installment.plans_woe              0.852     0.394     2.16     3.06e-2
## 11 housing_woe                              1.00      0.495     2.02     4.29e-2
## 12 property_woe                             0.189     0.588     0.322    7.48e-1
## 13 installment.rate.in.percentage.of.di~    1.93      0.580     3.32     8.86e-4
## 14 number.of.existing.credits.at.this.b~    0.149     0.719     0.207    8.36e-1
## 15 telephone_woe                            1.31      0.739     1.77     7.59e-2
## 16 personal.status.and.sex_woe              1.38      0.763     1.81     7.02e-2
    model_metrics(model)
    ## # A tibble: 1 x 4
##      ks   auc    iv  gini
##   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1 0.559 0.859  2.39 0.719
    model_metrics(model, newdata = dtest)
    ## # A tibble: 1 x 4
##      ks   auc    iv  gini
##   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1 0.447 0.762  1.09 0.524

    We can do feature selection:

    Feature selection

    glmnet

    model_fsglmnet <- featsel_glmnet(model, trace = FALSE)

    broom::tidy(model_fsglmnet)
    ## # A tibble: 12 x 5
##    term                                  estimate std.error statistic    p.value
##    <chr>                                    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
##  1 (Intercept)                             -0.723     0.122     -5.93    3.02e-9
##  2 status.of.existing.checking.account_~    0.764     0.165      4.63    3.61e-6
##  3 purpose_woe                              0.936     0.224      4.18    2.90e-5
##  4 credit.history_woe                       0.741     0.224      3.31    9.40e-4
##  5 duration.in.month_woe                    1.03      0.246      4.19    2.80e-5
##  6 credit.amount_woe                        1.12      0.246      4.57    4.92e-6
##  7 savings.account.and.bonds_woe            0.740     0.280      2.64    8.22e-3
##  8 present.employment.since_woe             1.03      0.333      3.10    1.91e-3
##  9 age.in.years_woe                         0.799     0.327      2.44    1.46e-2
## 10 other.installment.plans_woe              0.787     0.385      2.05    4.08e-2
## 11 housing_woe                              0.938     0.429      2.19    2.87e-2
## 12 installment.rate.in.percentage.of.di~    1.98      0.576      3.43    6.02e-4
    model_metrics(model_fsglmnet)
    ## # A tibble: 1 x 4

##   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1 0.559 0.855  2.44 0.709
    model_metrics(model_fsglmnet, newdata = dtest)
    ## # A tibble: 1 x 4
##      ks   auc    iv  gini

## 1 0.456 0.770  1.15 0.540

    Setpwise forward

    model_fsstep <- featsel_stepforward(model, trace = FALSE)

broom::tidy(model_fsstep)
    ## # A tibble: 14 x 5
##    term                                  estimate std.error statistic    p.value
##    <chr>                                    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>

##  2 status.of.existing.checking.account_~    0.779     0.167      4.67    3.01e-6

    See if we can remove variables via inspecting predictive measures.

    dfmetrics <- model_partials(model_fsglmnet, newdata = dtest)
dfmetrics
    ## # A tibble: 22 x 6
##    variable                                sample    ks   auc    iv  gini
##    <fct>                                   <fct>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
##  1 status.of.existing.checking.account_woe train  0.340 0.694 0.565 0.387
##  2 status.of.existing.checking.account_woe test   0.349 0.708 0.608 0.416
##  3 purpose_woe                             train  0.376 0.735 0.811 0.469
##  4 purpose_woe                             test   0.343 0.696 0.627 0.392
##  5 credit.history_woe                      train  0.413 0.759 1.10  0.518
##  6 credit.history_woe                      test   0.363 0.733 0.781 0.466
##  7 duration.in.month_woe                   train  0.489 0.800 1.69  0.599
##  8 duration.in.month_woe                   test   0.457 0.769 1.13  0.538
##  9 credit.amount_woe                       train  0.519 0.817 1.75  0.635
## 10 credit.amount_woe                       test   0.452 0.764 1.13  0.529
## # ... with 12 more rows
    dfmetrics %>% 
  select(-gini, -iv) %>% 
  risk3r:::plot.model_partials() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

    Scorecard

    POINTS0   <- 600
PDO       <- 20
ODDS0     <- 1/50

scrcrd <- scorecard::scorecard(
  bins = bins, 
  model = model_fsglmnet, 
  points0 = POINTS0,
  pdo = PDO,
  odds0 = ODDS0,
  basepoints_eq0 = TRUE
  )

scrcrd$age.in.years
    ##        variable       bin count count_distr neg pos   posprob        woe
## 1: age.in.years [-Inf,26)    98  0.19878296  50  48 0.4897959  0.6553693
## 2: age.in.years   [26,27)    28  0.05679513  22   6 0.2142857 -0.6030917
## 3: age.in.years [27, Inf)   367  0.74442191 257 110 0.2997275 -0.1524044
##        bin_iv  total_iv breaks is_special_values points
## 1: 0.09221521 0.1273082     26             FALSE     31
## 2: 0.01826399 0.1273082     27             FALSE     60
## 3: 0.01682900 0.1273082    Inf             FALSE     50
    scrcrd2 <- scorecard::scorecard2(
  dt = filter(credit, sample == "train"),
  y = "bad",
  bins = bins,
  x = str_remove(names(coef(model_fsglmnet))[-1], "_woe$"),
  points0 = POINTS0,
  pdo = PDO,
  odds0 = ODDS0,
  basepoints_eq0 = TRUE
  )

scrcrd2$age.in.years
    ##        variable       bin count count_distr neg pos   posprob        woe
## 1: age.in.years [-Inf,26)    98  0.19878296  50  48 0.4897959  0.6553693
## 2: age.in.years   [26,27)    28  0.05679513  22   6 0.2142857 -0.6030917
## 3: age.in.years [27, Inf)   367  0.74442191 257 110 0.2997275 -0.1524044
##        bin_iv  total_iv breaks is_special_values points
## 1: 0.09221521 0.1273082     26             FALSE     31
## 2: 0.01826399 0.1273082     27             FALSE     60
## 3: 0.01682900 0.1273082    Inf             FALSE     50
    dtrain %>% 
  group_by(age.in.years_woe) %>% 
  summarise(
    dplyr::n(),
    mean(bad)
  )
    ## # A tibble: 3 x 3
##   age.in.years_woe `dplyr::n()` `mean(bad)`
